thread.title: Gardner man charged with rape, arson following Tuesday house fire
thread.title_full: Gardner man charged with rape, arson following Tuesday house fire

author: @kctv5
title: Gardner man charged with rape, arson following Tuesday house fire
text:
Gardner man charged with rape, arson following Tuesday house fire
GARDNER, Kan. (KCTV) - A Gardner man is being held on a $500,000 bond after allegedly raping an individual and then setting a house on fire.
After police in Gardner alerted the public to a Tuesday night house fire in the area of Heather and Zachary Drive at 1199 E. Santa Fe for an arson investigation, Eric Payne was taken into custody in Johnson County.
Payne was arrested early Wednesday morning and is being held in the Johnson County Detention Center. He’s charged with felony rape, aggravated arson and aggravated battery for an incident on Tuesday, Feb. 18, 2025.
Gardner Police said Tuesday officers located and were able to successfully rescue a woman from the fire and she was taken to a local hospital where she was in stable condition.
“An investigation into the cause of the fire revealed that the incident was a result of arson,” Gardner Police said.
Police said the case remained under investigation.
Payne made his first appearance in court Thursday at 1:30 p.m. He’s scheduled for a preliminary hearing on Feb. 27, 2025.
